009package Ch15_Color_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.LabColorSpace;
018import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.LinearRgb65ColorSpace;
019import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.LuvColorSpace;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.Rotation2D;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
022import imagingbook.common.image.ColorPack;
023import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
024import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
025import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
026
027import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
028
029import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
030
031/**
032 * <p>
033 * This plugin rotates the input image. This operation is performed in a color space specified by the user. The intent
034 * is to visualize the differences of linear interpolation when applied in different color spaces. The default test
035 * image (opened automatically if no other image is open) makes the differences noticeable. See Ch. 15 of [1] for
036 * details. Bilinear interpolation is used to avoid negative component values.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
040 * (2022).
041 * </p>
042 *
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2022/09/02
045 */
046public class Geometry_Rotate_Color implements PlugInFilter {
047        
048        enum ColorStackType {
049                Lab, Luv, LinearRGB, sRGB
050        }
051        
052        private static double Angle = 15;                                                       // rotation angle (in degrees)
053        private static ColorStackType CsType = ColorStackType.Lab;      // color space to use
054
055        private ImagePlus im = null;
056
057        /**
058         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
059         */
060        public Geometry_Rotate_Color() {
061                if (noCurrentImage()) {
062                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.ColorTest3);
063                }
064        }
065        
066    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
067        this.im = imp;
068        return DOES_RGB + NO_CHANGES;
069    }
070
071    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
072        if (!getParameters()) 
073                return;
074        
075        ColorPack colStack = new ColorPack((ColorProcessor) ip);
076        ColorSpace cs = null;
077        
078        switch (CsType) {
079                case Lab :              cs = LabColorSpace.getInstance(); break;
080                        case Luv:               cs = LuvColorSpace.getInstance(); break;
081                        case LinearRGB: cs = LinearRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance(); break;
082                        case sRGB:              cs = null; break;
083        }
084        
085        if (cs != null) {
086                colStack.convertFromSrgbTo(cs);
087        }
088        
089        Rotation2D imap = new Rotation2D(-2 * Math.PI * Angle / 360);   // inverse mapping (target to source)
090        FloatProcessor[] processors = colStack.getProcessors();
091  
092        ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(imap, null, InterpolationMethod.Bilinear);
093                for (FloatProcessor fp : processors) {
094                        //imap.applyTo(fp, InterpolationMethod.Bilinear);
095                        mapper.map(fp);
096                }
097        
098                colStack.convertToSrgb();
099                ColorProcessor cp = colStack.toColorProcessor();
100        String title = im.getShortTitle() + "-rotated-" + CsType.name();
101        ImagePlus result = new ImagePlus(title, cp);
102        result.show();
103    }
104    
105    boolean getParameters() {
106                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
107                gd.addEnumChoice("Color space", CsType);
108                gd.addNumericField("Rotation angle", Angle, 0);
109                
110                gd.showDialog();
111                if(gd.wasCanceled())
112                        return false;
113                
114                CsType = gd.getNextEnumChoice(ColorStackType.class);
115                Angle = gd.getNextNumber();
116                return true;
117    }
118
119}
120
